generation

Class MazeFactoryTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • generation.MazeFactoryTest

  • public class MazeFactoryTest
extends java.lang.Object
    This class has the responsibility of testing the MazeFactory class. It will test all of the methods in the class, as well as some additional properties of the maze to make sure that MazeBuilder is running correctly
    Author:
    corythomas

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MazeFactoryTest() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void setUp()
      This method helps to set up all of the fields that will be needed for the tests.
      void testCancel()
      This tests the cancel method in the MazeFactory class to make sure it cancels the thread and sets the variables to null.
      void testIsOneBorderExit()
      This test makes sure that the maze has exactly one exit and that that exit is located on the border of the maze.
      void testIsPerfect()
      This test makes sure that the maze is perfect, meaning there are no loops and that you can access one cell from any other cell in the maze.
      void testMazeFactory()
      This method will test to make sure that the constructor for MazeFactory creates an object.
      void testMazeFactoryBoolean()
      This test makes sure that the constructor that allows for a boolean input creates an object.
      void testOrder()
      This will test the order method in the MazeFactory java class.
      void testStubOrder()
      This method tests both of the constructors for the StubOrder class to make sure they are creating StubOrder objects.
      void testWaitTillDelivered()
      This method tests to make sure that when the waitTillDelivered method from the MazeFactory class is called everything else is not done until the thread finishes and returns the values.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • MazeFactoryTest

        public MazeFactoryTest()

    • Method Detail

      • setUp

        public void setUp()
        This method helps to set up all of the fields that will be needed for the tests. Two MazeFactory objects were initialized, one to test each of the different constructors, and two stubs were created, one for each of the constructors.

      • testMazeFactory

        public void testMazeFactory()
        This method will test to make sure that the constructor for MazeFactory creates an object.

      • testMazeFactoryBoolean

        public void testMazeFactoryBoolean()
        This test makes sure that the constructor that allows for a boolean input creates an object.

      • testOrder

        public void testOrder()
        This will test the order method in the MazeFactory java class.

      • testStubOrder

        public void testStubOrder()
        This method tests both of the constructors for the StubOrder class to make sure they are creating StubOrder objects. It also makes sure that the get methods of the class are working properly.

      • testCancel

        public void testCancel()
        This tests the cancel method in the MazeFactory class to make sure it cancels the thread and sets the variables to null.

      • testWaitTillDelivered

        public void testWaitTillDelivered()
        This method tests to make sure that when the waitTillDelivered method from the MazeFactory class is called everything else is not done until the thread finishes and returns the values.

      • testIsOneBorderExit

        public void testIsOneBorderExit()
        This test makes sure that the maze has exactly one exit and that that exit is located on the border of the maze.

      • testIsPerfect

        public void testIsPerfect()
        This test makes sure that the maze is perfect, meaning there are no loops and that you can access one cell from any other cell in the maze.
